docs.title: MCP News Generator
docs.text: Welcome to the MCP News Generator documentation! This MCP (Model Context Protocol) server helps you automatically fetch the latest motorcycle news and generate 3-second video clips to update your autoclip project's news tiles.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 🔍 Fetch Motorcycle News: Aggregates latest news from multiple RSS feeds
  • 🎬 Generate Video Clips: Creates 3-second video clips with text overlays
  • 📝 Update News Tiles: Automatically updates your project's news configuration
  • 📋 List Videos: View all currently configured videos

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Installation Guide - Get started quickly
  • Tools Overview - Learn about available tools
  • Workflows - Common usage patterns

docs.title: News Sources
docs.text:
The server fetches news from:

  • Motorcycle News - Latest industry news and reviews
  • Cycle World - Comprehensive motorcycle coverage
  • RideApart - Riding tips and motorcycle culture
  • RevZilla - Gear reviews and how-to guides

docs.title: Supported Categories
docs.text:
Videos can be categorized as:

  • electric - Electric motorcycle news
  • racing - Racing and track news
  • luxury - Premium and superbike content
  • tech - Technology and innovation
  • classic - Vintage and classic bikes
  • industry - Market and business news

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Jump right in with our Quick Start Guide or check out the Installation instructions.

docs.title: Example Usage
docs.text:
1. "Fetch the latest 10 motorcycle news from all sources"
2. "Generate a video for the top BMW story with category 'racing'"
3. "Update the news tiles with the newly generated video"

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
The MCP News Generator is built with:

  • MCP SDK - Model Context Protocol implementation
  • httpx - Async HTTP client for RSS feeds
  • feedparser - RSS/Atom feed parsing
  • moviepy - Video generation and editing
  • Pillow - Image processing

docs.title: Support
docs.text: For issues, questions, or contributions, please visit the GitHub repository.

docs.title: What is MCP?
docs.text: MCP (Model Context Protocol) is an open standard that enables AI applications to connect to external data sources and tools. It allows language models to interact with your systems through a standardized interface.

docs.title: What does this server do?
docs.text: The MCP News Generator fetches the latest motorcycle news from RSS feeds, generates 3-second video clips with text overlays, and updates your autoclip project's news tiles automatically.

docs.title: Do I need an API key?
docs.text: No! All news sources are publicly available RSS feeds that don't require authentication.

docs.title: What Python version do I need?
docs.text: Python 3.10 or higher is required.

docs.title: Do I need to install dependencies manually?
docs.text: No, uv pip install -e ".[dev]" installs all required dependencies automatically.

docs.title: Can I use this without VS Code or Claude?
docs.text: Yes! The server communicates via stdio and can work with any MCP-compatible client.

docs.title: Where should I install the server?
docs.text: Install it inside your autoclip project directory as mcp-news-generator/ for automatic path detection.

docs.title: How many news sources are supported?
docs.text:
Four sources by default: - Motorcycle News - Cycle World - RideApart - RevZilla Common Tread

You can add more by editing the NEWS_SOURCES dictionary in server.py.

docs.title: How long are the generated videos?
docs.text: All videos are exactly 3 seconds long by default.

docs.title: What video format is used?
docs.text: MP4 format with H.264 codec, 1920x1080 resolution at 24 FPS.

docs.title: Can I customize video styling?
docs.text: Yes! You can customize: - Background color - Text content - Category - Font sizes (by editing the code)

docs.title: How does the "append" vs "replace" mode work?
docs.text:
• Append: Adds new videos to the existing list
  • Replace: Removes all existing videos and adds only the new ones

docs.title: Will my existing videos be overwritten?
docs.text: No! Videos are saved with unique timestamps in their filenames.

docs.title: "Module not found" error
docs.text:
Activate your virtual environment:

# Windows
.venv\Scripts\activate

# macOS/Linux
source .venv/bin/activate

docs.title: Videos aren't being created
docs.text: Check that: 1. The videos/ directory exists 2. You have write permissions 3. There's sufficient disk space 4. moviepy dependencies are installed

docs.title: script.js isn't updating
docs.text: Verify: 1. The path to script.js is correct 2. You have write permissions 3. The file contains a videosData array

docs.title: News fetch returns no results
docs.text: This could be due to: 1. Network connectivity issues 2. RSS feed changes or downtime 3. Timeout (try increasing timeout value)

docs.title: "Permission denied" error
docs.text: Run with appropriate permissions or check: - File ownership - Directory permissions - Antivirus/security software blocking access

docs.title: How fast is news fetching?
docs.text: Fetching 10 items from all sources typically takes 2-5 seconds depending on network speed.

docs.title: How long does video generation take?
docs.text: Each 3-second video takes approximately 3-5 seconds to generate.

docs.title: Can I fetch news from multiple sources simultaneously?
docs.text: Yes! Using source: "all" fetches from all sources in parallel.

docs.title: Is there a limit on video file size?
docs.text: No built-in limit, but each 3-second 1080p video is approximately 500KB-1MB.

docs.title: Can I use this with other projects?
docs.text: Yes! Just update the path constants to point to your project's structure.

docs.title: Does it work with other MCP clients?
docs.text: Yes! Any MCP-compatible client can use this server.

docs.title: Can I host this remotely?
docs.text: Currently configured for stdio (local) transport. For remote hosting, you'd need to implement SSE or HTTP transport.

docs.title: Can I add my own news sources?
docs.text:
Yes! Edit the NEWS_SOURCES dictionary in server.py:

NEWS_SOURCES = {
    "your_source": "https://example.com/feed/",
}

docs.title: How can I contribute?
docs.text: See the Contributing Guide for guidelines.

docs.title: Where can I report bugs?
docs.text: Open an issue on the GitHub repository with: - Description of the issue - Steps to reproduce - Error messages - Environment details

docs.title: Can I modify the video generation?
docs.text: Yes! The video generation code is in the generate_news_video function. You can customize: - Dimensions - Duration - Text styling - Animations - Transitions

docs.title: How do I add new tools?
docs.text:
1. Define the tool in list_tools()

  3. Add documentation
  4. Update tests

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Configure the MCP News Generator for your specific setup.

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
The server supports the following environment variables:

Variable Description Default AUTOCLIP_PATH Path to autoclip project Auto-detected VIDEOS_PATH Path to videos directory {AUTOCLIP_PATH}/videos SCRIPT_JS_PATH Path to script.js {AUTOCLIP_PATH}/script.js

docs.title: Setting Environment Variables
docs.text:
Windows (PowerShell)macOS/Linux 
$env:AUTOCLIP_PATH = "C:\path\to\autoclip"

export AUTOCLIP_PATH="/path/to/autoclip"

docs.title: VS Code Setup
docs.text:
Configure in .vscode/mcp.json:

{
  "servers": {
    "news-generator": {
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "uv",
      "args": [
        "--directory",
        "C:\\Users\\bhanupratapsingh.bh\\github-repos\\autoclip\\mcp-news-generator",
        "run",
        "python",
        "src/mcp_news_generator/server.py"
      ]
    }
  }
}

Important: Update the --directory path to match your installation location.

docs.title: Claude Desktop Setup
docs.text:

Edit src/mcp_news_generator/server.py:

docs.title: Default Settings
docs.text:
• Duration: 3 seconds
  • Resolution: 1920x1080 (Full HD)
  • FPS: 24
  • Codec: libx264
  • Background Color: #1a1a1a

docs.title: Customizing Video Generation
docs.text:
Modify parameters when calling generate_news_video:

Generate a video with:

docs.title: Supported Video Categories
docs.text:
Configure your videos with these categories:

  • electric - Electric motorcycles
  • racing - Racing content
  • luxury - Premium bikes
  • tech - Technology news
  • classic - Vintage bikes
  • industry - Market news

docs.title: Auto-Detection
docs.text:
The server automatically detects paths relative to its location:

AUTOCLIP_PATH = Path(__file__).parent.parent.parent.parent
VIDEOS_PATH = AUTOCLIP_PATH / "videos"
SCRIPT_JS_PATH = AUTOCLIP_PATH / "script.js"

docs.title: Manual Path Configuration
docs.text:
For custom locations, edit the path constants in server.py:

AUTOCLIP_PATH = Path("C:/your/custom/path")
VIDEOS_PATH = AUTOCLIP_PATH / "custom_videos"
SCRIPT_JS_PATH = AUTOCLIP_PATH / "custom_script.js"

docs.title: Logging Configuration
docs.text:
The server uses Python's logging module. Configure verbosity:

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)  # INFO, DEBUG, WARNING, ERROR

docs.title: HTTP Timeouts
docs.text:
Adjust fetch timeout for slow connections:

response = await client.get(feed_url, timeout=30.0)  # Default: 10.0

docs.title: News Fetch Limits
docs.text:
Control how many items to fetch per source:

for entry in feed.entries[:limit]:  # Default: 10

docs.title: Path Issues
docs.text:
If paths aren't detected correctly, set them explicitly:

$env:AUTOCLIP_PATH = "C:\Users\bhanupratapsingh.bh\github-repos\autoclip"

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text:
Ensure the videos directory is writable:

chmod 755 videos/  # macOS/Linux

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide will help you install and set up the MCP News Generator server.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing, ensure you have:

  • Python 3.10 or higher - Download Python
  • uv - Python package manager
  • Git - For cloning the repository

docs.title: Installing uv
docs.text:
If you don't have uv installed:

WindowsmacOS/Linux 
powershell -ExecutionPolicy ByPass -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"

curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

After installation, restart your terminal.

docs.title: 1. Navigate to the Project Directory
docs.text: cd C:\Users\bhanupratapsingh.bh\github-repos\autoclip\mcp-news-generator

docs.title: 2. Create Virtual Environment
docs.text:
uv venv

This creates a .venv directory with an isolated Python environment.

docs.title: 3. Install Dependencies
docs.text:
uv pip install -e ".[dev]"

This installs:

  • Core dependencies (mcp, httpx, feedparser, moviepy, pillow)
  • Development tools (pytest, black, ruff)

docs.title: 4. Verify Installation
docs.text:
uv run python src/mcp_news_generator/server.py --help

If installed correctly, the server should start without errors.

docs.title: Installing Documentation Tools
docs.text:
To build and serve documentation:

uv pip install -e ".[docs]"

This installs MkDocs and related plugins.

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
• Make sure Python is added to your PATH
  • Use PowerShell or Command Prompt for running commands
  • File paths use backslashes: C:\path\to\file

docs.title: macOS/Linux
docs.text:
• You might need to use python3 instead of python
  • File paths use forward slashes: /path/to/file
  • Some operations might require sudo

docs.title: "uv: command not found"
docs.text: Restart your terminal after installing uv, or add it to your PATH manually.

docs.title: "Python version not supported"
docs.text:
Ensure Python 3.10+ is installed:

python --version

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text: Run with appropriate permissions or use a virtual environment (recommended).

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get started with MCP News Generator in minutes!

docs.text:
Start the MCP server using:

uv run python src/mcp_news_generator/server.py

The server runs in stdio mode and communicates via JSON-RPC messages.

docs.title: Tools Overview
docs.text: The MCP News Generator provides four powerful tools for managing motorcycle news content.

docs.title: 1. fetch_motorcycle_news
docs.text:
Fetches the latest motorcycle news from various RSS feeds.

Capabilities: - Aggregate news from multiple sources - Filter by specific news source - Limit number of results - Parse RSS/Atom feeds

Parameters:

Parameter Type Required Default Description source string No "all" News source: motorcyclenews, cycleworld, rideapart, revzilla, or all limit integer No 10 Maximum number of items to fetch

Example Usage:

Fetch the latest 5 news items from motorcyclenews

Response Format:

{
  "source": "motorcyclenews",
  "title": "BMW Unveils New R 1300 GS",
  "description": "German manufacturer announces flagship adventure bike...",
  "link": "https://www.motorcyclenews.com/...",
  "published": "2025-12-22T10:00:00Z"
}

docs.title: 2. generate_news_video
docs.text:
Creates a 3-second video clip with text overlay from news content.

Capabilities: - Generate video from text - Customizable text styling - Category-based organization - Automatic file naming - HD quality output

Parameters:

Parameter Type Required Default Description title string Yes - Video title/headline (max 50 chars) description string Yes - Brief description (max 100 chars) category string Yes - One of: electric, racing, luxury, tech, classic, industry background_color string No "#1a1a1a" Hex color code for background

Example Usage:

Generate a video with:
- Title: "BMW R 1300 GS Launch"
- Description: "New flagship adventure bike with enhanced features"
- Category: racing

Response Format:

{
  "success": true,
  "filename": "racing_bmw_r_1300_gs_launch_20251222_103045.mp4",
  "path": "C:\\...\\videos\\racing_bmw_r_1300_gs_launch_20251222_103045.mp4",
  "videoUrl": "videos/racing_bmw_r_1300_gs_launch_20251222_103045.mp4"
}

Video Specifications: - Resolution: 1920x1080 (Full HD) - Duration: 3 seconds - FPS: 24 - Codec: H.264 (libx264) - Format: MP4

docs.title: 3. update_news_tiles
docs.text:
Updates the autoclip project's script.js with new video entries.

Capabilities: - Append new videos - Replace all videos - Maintain ID sequencing - Preserve existing formatting - Backup-friendly operations

Parameters:

Parameter Type Required Default Description videos array Yes - Array of video objects to add mode string No "append" "append" to add, "replace" to replace all

Video Object Structure:

{
  "title": "Video Title",
  "description": "Video description",
  "category": "racing",
  "videoUrl": "videos/filename.mp4",
  "date": "2025-12-22"
}

Example Usage:

Update the news tiles with these videos:
- Title: "BMW R 1300 GS Launch", category: racing, videoUrl: videos/...mp4
in append mode

Response:

Successfully added 1 video(s) to script.js

docs.title: 4. list_current_videos
docs.text:
Lists all currently configured videos in the autoclip project.

Capabilities: - View all videos - Check current count - Preview configuration - Verify updates

Parameters:

None required.

Example Usage:

List current videos

or

Show me all the videos currently configured

Response Format:

Found 15 videos configured in script.js

Preview:
{ id: 1, title: "BMW R 1300 GS Launch", description: "...", category: "racing", ... },
{ id: 2, title: "Ducati Panigale V4", description: "...", category: "luxury", ... },
...

docs.title: Tool Workflow
docs.text:
The tools are designed to work together in a natural workflow:

graph LR
    A[fetch_motorcycle_news] --> B[Review News]
    B --> C[generate_news_video]
    C --> D[update_news_tiles]
    D --> E[list_current_videos]
    E --> F[Verify Update]

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
All tools include comprehensive error handling:

  • Network errors: Timeout and retry logic
  • File errors: Permission and path validation
  • Parse errors: Graceful fallbacks
  • Validation errors: Clear error messages

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Fetch News First: Always start by fetching news to get fresh content
  2. Review Before Generating: Check news items before creating videos
  3. Test Videos: Generate one video first to verify settings
  4. Backup script.js: Keep backups before using "replace" mode
  5. Verify Updates: Always list videos after updating
